project_abstract.cdata: The Hussein Thermal Power Project is the first Bank power project in Jordan and will help the power sector to change over from diesel to steam power generation. The objectives of the project are to provide a reliable and centralized source of power. It includes: (a) construction of a thermal power station at Zarqa, including installation of two 33-MW steam-electric power units and a 12-MW gas turbine; (b) consultants services for engineering, management and studies; (c) training of operating staff.
